Welcome to HomeWork_14’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

main.healthchecker(db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The healthchecker function is a simple function that checks if the database is configured correctly. It does this by executing a SQL query and checking if it returns any results. If it doesn’t, then the database isn’t configured correctly.

Parameters:

db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with a message

Doc-author:

Trelent

async main.startup()¶
async main.validation_error_exception_handler(request: Request, exc_: ValidationError)¶

The validation_error_exception_handler function is a custom exception handler that returns a JSON response with a status code of 422 and the error message. This function is used to handle ValidationError exceptions.

Parameters:

  • request – Request: Access the request object, which contains information about the http request

  • exc – ValidationError: Catch any validation error exceptions that might occur

Returns:

A json response with a 422 status code,

Doc-author:

Trelent

async main.value_error_exception_handler(request: Request, exc_: ValueError)¶

The value_error_exception_handler function is a custom exception handler that returns a JSON response with the message; when it catches an exception of type ValueError.

Parameters:

  • request – Request: Access the request object

  • exc – ValueError: Catch any value error exceptions that are raised in the app

Returns:

A json response object with a status code of 400 and the exception message

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_cnt(body: ContactInput, db: Session) → Contact¶

The create_cnt function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactInput: Validate the input data

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A contact object, which is the same type as the return value of get_cnt

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.delete_cnt_by_id(cnt_id: int, db: Session) → Contact | None¶
The delete_cnt_by_id function deletes a contact from the database by its id.
Args:

cnt_id (int): The id of the contact to be deleted. db (Session): A connection to the database.

Parameters:

  • cnt_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be deleted

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The deleted contact or none if the contact doesn’t exist

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_birth_list(db: Session) → list[Type[src.database.models.Contact]]¶

The get_birth_list function returns a list of contacts whose birthday is within the next 7 days. The function takes in a database session and uses it to query the Contact table for all contacts whose birthday falls between today’s date and seven days from now. The results are ordered by birthday.

Parameters:

db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts whose birthday is in the next 7 days

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_cnt(db: Session, filter_type: int = 0, filter_str: str | None = None) → list[Type[src.database.models.Contact]]¶
The get_cnt function is used to retrieve a list of contacts from the database.

The function accepts two parameters: filter_type and filter_str. If no parameters are passed, all contacts in the database will be returned in alphabetical order by first name and last name.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • filter_type – int: Filter the contacts by first name, last name, email or birthday

  • filter_str – str: Filter the contacts based on a string

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_cnt_by_id(cnt_id: int, db: Session) → Contact¶
The get_cnt_by_id function returns a contact by its id.
Args:

cnt_id (int): The id of the contact to be returned. db (Session): A database session object that is used to query the database for contacts.

Parameters:

  • cnt_id – int: Get the contact with the given id

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.update_cnt(cnt_id: int, body: ContactInput, db: Session) → Contact | None¶
The update_cnt function updates a contact in the database.
Args:

cnt_id (int): The id of the contact to update. body (ContactInput): The updated information for the contact.

Parameters:

  • cnt_id – int: Identify the contact to be deleted

  • body – ContactInput: Pass the data from the request body to update_cnt function

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The updated contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.change_password(user: User, password: str, db: Session) → None¶

The change_password function takes a user and password, then updates the user’s password in the database.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Pass in the user object

  • password – str: Pass in the new password

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None, which means that it doesn’t return anything

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes in an email and a database session, and sets the confirmed field of the user with that email to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email of the user to be confirmed

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserInput, db: Session) → User¶

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserInput: Get the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User | None¶

The get_user_by_email function takes in an email and a database session, and returns the user with that email if it exists. If no such user exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email address of the user

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session to the function

Returns:

The first user with a matching email address

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email: str, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the user by email

  • url – str: Pass in the url of the avatar to be updated

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The updated user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, refresh_token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Identify the user in the database

  • refresh_token – str | None: Specify the type of the refresh_token parameter

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.change_password(token: str, body: NewPasswordInput, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The change_password function is used to change the password of a user.

It takes in a token and body as parameters, where the token is used to verify that the user has access to change their password, and the body contains information about what they want their new password to be.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the email from the token

  • body – NewPasswordInput: Get the new password from the user

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with the key &quot;detail&quot; and value msg

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

It takes in the token that was sent to the user’s email and uses it to get their email address. The function then checks if there is a user with that email, and if not, returns an error message. If there is a user with that email, it checks whether or not they have already confirmed their account. If they have already confirmed their account, it returns an error message saying so; otherwise, the function confirms the account by setting its ‘confirmed’ field to True.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the email from the token

  • db – Session: Connect to the database

Returns:

A message that the email has been confirmed

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.forgot_password(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The forgot_password function is used to send a password reset email to the user.

The function takes in an email address and sends a password reset link to that address. If the user does not exist, then an error message is returned.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the application

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A json object with a detail key and value

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The login function is used to authenticate a user.

It takes in the username and password of the user, and returns an access token if successful. The access token can be used to make authenticated requests.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password from the request body

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with the access token, refresh token and the type of bearer

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token.

The function takes in a refresh token and returns an access_token, a new refresh_token, and the type of token. If there is no user with that email or if the user’s current refresh_token does not match what was passed in, then it will return an error message.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the token from the request header

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with the access_token, refresh_token and token_type

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to send an email to the user with a link that will allow them to confirm their account. The function takes in a RequestEmail object, which contains the email of the user who wants to confirm their account. It then checks if there is already an unconfirmed account associated with that email address, and if so it sends an email containing a confirmation link.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the application

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A message to the user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.reset_password(token: str, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The reset_password function is used to reset a user’s password.

It takes in the token from the email sent to the user, and then uses that token to get their email address. Then it gets their account information using that email address, and returns an HTML page with a form for them to change their password.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • request – Request: Get the request object

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A templateresponse object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserInput, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The signup function creates a new user in the database.
It takes a UserInput object as input, which contains the following fields:

  • email (required): The email address of the user to be created. Must be unique.

  • password (required): The password for this account, hashed using bcrypt before being stored in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserInput: Get the data from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the application

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository_users

Returns:

A dictionary with the detail key and a message as value

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactInput, _: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

The function takes a ContactInput object as input, which is validated by pydantic. If the validation fails, an HTTP 400 error is raised with details of what went wrong.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactInput: Pass the contact information to be created

  • _ – User: Get the current user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

Returns:

A contact object, which is a dictionary

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.delete_contact(cnt_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), _: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.

The function takes in an id of the contact to be deleted and returns a 204 status code if successful. If no such contact exists, it returns 404 status code.

Parameters:

  • cnt_id – int: Get the contact id from the path

  • _ – User: Make sure that the user is authenticated before they can delete a contact

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact(cnt_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), _: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_contact function returns a contact by id.

Parameters:

  • cnt_id – int: Get the contact id from the url

  • _ – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(filter_type: int = Query(0), filter_str: str | None = None, _: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts.

Parameters:

  • filter_type – int: Filter the contacts by type

  • filter_str – str | None: Filter the contacts by name or phone number

  • _ – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactInput, cnt_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), _: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

The function takes an id and a body as input, and returns the updated contact. If no contact is found with that id, it raises an HTTPException with status code 404 (Not Found).

Parameters:

  • body – ContactInput: Define the input schema,

  • cnt_id – int: Get the contact id from the url

  • _ – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Front¶

async src.routes.front.contacts(request: Request)¶

The contacts function is a view callable which returns an HTML page with the contact information.

Parameters:

request – Request: Get the request object

Returns:

The contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

src.routes.front.format_date(value)¶

The format_date function takes a datetime object and returns a string in the format dd.mm.yyyy.

Parameters:

value – Pass the value of the field to be formatted

Returns:

A string in the format dd.mm.yyyy

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.front.root(request: Request)¶

The root function is the entry point for the web application. It returns a TemplateResponse object, which renders an HTML template using Jinja2. The template is located in templates/index.html and uses data from request to render itself.

Parameters:

request – Request: Get the request object for the current request

Returns:

A template response object which is a subclass of response

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.read_users_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The read_users_me function is a GET endpoint that returns the current user’s information. It uses the auth_service to get the current user, and then returns it.

Parameters:

current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

The current user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The update_avatar_user function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Get the file that is uploaded by the user

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret key'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_access_token function creates a new access token.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the claims to be encoded in the JWT. expires_delta (Optional[float]): An optional parameter specifying how long, in seconds, the access token should last before expiring. If not specified, it defaults to 15 minutes.

Parameters:

  • self – Refer to the current object

  • data – dict: Pass the data that will be encoded in the jwt

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the access token

Returns:

A jwt token

Doc-author:

Trelent

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function takes a dictionary of data and returns a token. The token is encoded with the SECRET_KEY, which is set in the config file. The algorithm used to encode the token is also set in the config file.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the data that is to be encoded

Returns:

A token that is encoded with the user’s email address

Doc-author:

Trelent

create_password_token(data: dict)¶
The create_password_token function creates a password token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the user’s email and username.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the function a method of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the data to be encoded

Returns:

A token which is encoded with the user’s email, a timestamp and an expiry time

Doc-author:

Trelent

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the user’s id and username. expires_delta (Optional[float]): The number of seconds until the token expires, defaults to None.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Store the user’s id and username

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the refresh token

Returns:

An encoded refresh token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token. It takes a refresh_token as an argument and returns the email of the user if it’s valid. If not, it raises an HTTPException with status code 401 (UNAUTHORIZED) and detail ‘Could not validate credentials’.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass the refresh token to the function

Returns:

The email of the user who has logged in

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

UserRouter class. It takes in a token and db as parameters, and returns the user object associated with that token. If no user is found, it raises an exception.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the class attributes

  • token – str: Pass the token to the function

  • db – Session: Pass the database connection to the function

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_email_from_token(token: str, scope: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token and scope as input. It then decodes the token using the SECRET_KEY and ALGORITHM defined in the class. If it is successful, it checks that the scope of this token matches what was passed to get_email_from_token. If so, it returns an email address from within this payload.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass in the token that is to be decoded

  • scope – str: Check if the scope of the token is valid

Returns:

The email address of the user associated with the token

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_password_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_password_from_token function is used to decode the password token that was sent in the email. The function takes a token as an argument and returns the password if it is valid. If not, it raises an error.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass the token to this function

Returns:

The password from the token

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

The get_password_hash function takes a password as input and returns the hash of that password. The hash is generated using the pwd_context object, which is an instance of Flask-Bcrypt’s Bcrypt class.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Get the password from the user

Returns:

A hashed password

Doc-author:

Trelent

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and hashed password as arguments. It then uses the pwd_context object to verify that the plain-text password matches the hashed one.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • plain_password – Check the password entered by the user

  • hashed_password – Compare the hashed password in the database with the plain text password entered by user

Returns:

A boolean value

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶
The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to confirm their email address.
The function takes in three parameters:

-email: EmailStr, the user’s email address. -username: str, the username of the user who is registering for an account. This will be used in a greeting message within the body of the email sent to them. -host: str, this is used as part of a URL that will be included in an HTML template for sending emails.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Validate the email address

  • username – str: Pass the username to the email template

  • host – str: Pass the host of the server to the email template

Returns:

A coroutine, which is a special type of object that works with asyncio

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.services.email.send_forgot_password(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶
The send_forgot_password function sends an email to the user with a link to reset their password.
Args:

email (str): The user’s email address. username (str): The user’s username. host (str): The hostname of the server where this function is being called from.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Specify the email address of the user who forgot their password

  • username – str: Display the username in the email

  • host – str: Pass the host name to the template

Returns:

A coroutine, which is an object that can be used to start a task

Doc-author:

Trelent
